pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Wine is an Open Source implementation of the Windows API on top of X and Unix.
Think of Wine as a compatibility layer for running Windows programs. Wine does not require Microsoft Windows, as it is a completely free alternative implementation of the Windows API consisting of 100% non-Microsoft code, however Wine can optionally use native Windows DLLs if they are available. Wine provides both a development toolkit for porting Windows source code to Unix as well as a program loader, allowing many unmodified Windows programs to run on x86-based Unixes, including Linux, FreeBSD, and Solaris.
This variant of the Wine packaging does not include external patchsets

use.flag: Enable support for running x86_64 applications on arm64 via binary translation
Use sys-devel/crossdev for the toolchain rather than dev-util/mingw64-toolchain (requires manual setting up and is mostly unsupported, try disabling if have issues)
Pull in games-emulation/dosbox to run DOS applications
Build PE files using dev-util/mingw64-toolchain (more tested) rather than llvm-core/clang (newer)
Enable support for configuring remote shares using net-fs/samba
Pull in net-fs/samba with winbind for NTLM auth support

Enable the "new" wow64 mode that allows running 32bit applications without 32bit ELF multilib by mapping to 64bit calls. Generally works well with wine-11.0 or newer, but may or may not have a small perforamce impact or other issues. If USE=mingw is set, still need the default abi_x86_32 set on dev-util/mingw64-toolchain but that can be done even with /no-multilib/ profiles.
This can also be enabled on arm64 to allow running x86 applications via binary translation.
